detaileddescription.para: Indicate that the device was opened
Indicate that the device running in poll method
Indicate that the device running in interrupt method
Indicate that the device working as master
Indicate that the device working as slave
Bit 0 for device enabled state, disabled
Bit 0 for device enabled state, enabled
Bit 1 for device in transmit state
Bit 2 for device in receive state
Bit 3 for device in transfer state
Bit 4 for device in transmit abort state
Bit 5 for device in receive abort state
Bit 6 for device in transfer abort state

Invalid Interrupt Vector Number When interrupt number is set to this value, all interrupt related function in the device driver source code shouldn't be called, that means the interrupt processing maybe done in outside of device driver, maybe done in the device object instantiation
default system device control command base(defined by embARC)
default user device control command base(defined by user) in user implementing
Device ID as 0, which is the first ID
Device callback function typedef. This is usually used in device callback settings, and ptr should be the device object pointer, such as DEV_IIC *

briefdescription.para: header file to define common definitions for device layer

detaileddescription.para: Here in this file provide definitions that need by other devices in device layer
